definition: Ocean platform in Zhongnanhai 中南海[Zhong1 nan2 hai3] surrounded by water on three sides, recreation area for imperial wives and concubines, more recently for communist top brass

sentences.english: Emperor Kangxi being an enthusiastic angler, Ying'Tai was an ideal fishing spot for him.
sentences.chinese: 康熙皇帝喜爱钓鱼，瀛台是他理想的垂钓之处。

definition: coup by Dowager Empress Cixi 慈禧太后[Ci2 xi3 tai4 hou4] ending the 1898 attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
to imprison/to place under house arrest
the Forbidden City/the Imperial Palace in Beijing/same as 故宮|故宫[Gu4 gong1]
area to the west of the Forbidden City, now divided into Zhongnanhai and Beihai
Empress Dowager Cixi or Ts'u Hsi (1835-1908), regent 1861-1908
Grand Prince Yixin (1833-1898), sixth son of Emperor Daoguang, prominent politician, diplomat and modernizer in late Qing
Empress Dowager Cixi or Ts'u Hsi (reigned 1861-1908)
Puyi, personal name of the last Qing emperor (reigned as child 1909-1911), the subject of Bertolucci's biopic The Last Emperor
the Qing court (as government of China)
